com.messente.verigator

Class Verigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.messente.verigator.Verigator

  • public class Verigator
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for using the Verigator API

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Verigator(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      The constructor that should be used for creating a Verigator object API credentials can be found from https://dashboard.messente.com
      Verigator(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String apiUrl)
      This constructor should not be normally used
      Verigator(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String apiBaseUrl, java.lang.String apiVersion)
      This constructor should not be normally used

    • Constructor Detail

      • Verigator

        public Verigator(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password)
        The constructor that should be used for creating a Verigator object API credentials can be found from https://dashboard.messente.com
        Parameters:
        username - your Messente API username
        password - your Messente API password

    • Method Detail

      • getHttp

        public com.messente.verigator.Http getHttp()

      • getService

        public Service getService(java.lang.String serviceId)
                   throws VerigatorException
        Retrieves service from Verigator API
        Parameters:
        serviceId - UUID of the service in Verigator
        Returns:
        retrieved Service object in Verigator
        Throws:
        NoSuchResourceException - if you have specified the wrong service id
        ResourceForbiddenException - if you are not allowed to add users to the specified service
        ResourceAlreadyExists - if the specified user already exists
        WrongCredentialsException - if you have specified the incorrect credentials
        VerigatorInternalError - if a server-side error occurs
        VerigatorException - if a connection problem occurs

      • createService

        public Service createService(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String fqdn)
                      throws VerigatorException
        Creates a new service with the specified name and FQDN in Verigator The returned Service object includes the service ID (getServiceId() method) which should be stored by your service
        Parameters:
        name - The name of your service
        fqdn - FQDN or Full qualified domain name, such as www.example.com
        Returns:
        created Service object in Verigator
        Throws:
        InvalidInvocationError - if empty or null empty values are provided for name and fqdn
        ResourceAlreadyExists - if a service with this name already exists
        WrongCredentialsException - if you have specified the incorrect credentials
        VerigatorInternalError - if a server-side error occurs
        VerigatorException - if a connection problem occurs
